news_summary: Breakthroughs in atomic imaging, advanced AI solving complex math at top student levels, and swift resolution of major network outages showcase significant progress and reliability in technology today.
news_summary_fr: Les percées dans le domaine de l'imagerie atomique, l'IA avancée qui permet de résoudre des problèmes mathématiques complexes pour les étudiants les plus doués et la résolution rapide des pannes de réseau majeures témoignent des progrès considérables et de la fiabilité de la technologie aujourd'hui.
news_summary_es: Los grandes avances en la obtención de imágenes atómicas, la inteligencia artificial avanzada que resuelve complejas operaciones matemáticas a los mejores niveles y la rápida resolución de los principales cortes de red ponen de manifiesto el importante progreso y la fiabilidad de la tecnología actual.

articles.title: You’ve never seen atoms like this before: A hidden motion revealed
articles.summary: A pioneering team at the University of Maryland has captured the first-ever images of atomic thermal vibrations, unlocking an unseen world of motion within two-dimensional materials. Their innovative electron ptychography technique revealed elusive “moiré phasons,” a long-theorized phenomenon that governs heat, electronic behavior, and structural order at the atomic level. This discovery not only confirms decades-old theories but also provides a new lens for building the future of quantum computing, ultra-efficient electronics, and advanced nanosensors.
articles.content:
Researchers investigating atomic-scale phenomena impacting next-generation electronic and quantum devices have captured the first microscopy images of atomic thermal vibrations, revealing a new type of motion that could reshape the design of quantum technologies and ultrathin electronics.

Yichao Zhang, an assistant professor in the University of Maryland Department of Materials Science and Engineering, has developed an electron microscopy technique to directly image "moiré phasons" -- a physical phenomenon that impacts superconductivity and heat conduction in two-dimensional materials for next-generation electronic and quantum devices. A paper about the research, which documents images of the thermal vibration of individual atoms for the first time, published July 24 in the journal Science. (See video link below.)

Two-dimensional materials, which are sheet-like structures a few nanometers thick, are being explored as new components of next-generation quantum and electronic devices. A feature in twisted two-dimensional materials are "moiré phasons," critical to understanding the materials' thermal conductivity, electronic behavior, and structural order. Previously, moiré phasons were difficult to detect experimentally, preventing further understanding of the materials that could revolutionize quantum technologies and energy-efficient electronics.

Zhang's research team took on this challenge by using a new technique called "electron ptychography," which achieved the highest resolution documented (better than 15 picometer) and detected blurring of individual atoms caused by thermal vibrations. Her work has revealed that spatially localized moiré phasons dominate thermal vibrations of twisted two-dimensional materials, which fundamentally reshaped how scientists understand its impact.

The breakthrough study, which confirmed the longstanding theoretical predictions of moiré phasons, also demonstrated that "electron ptychography" can be used to map thermal vibrations with atomic precision for the first time -- which was previously an experimental capability out of reach.

"This is like decoding a hidden language of atomic motion," said Zhang. "Electron ptychography lets us see these subtle vibrations directly. Now we have a powerful new method to explore previously hidden physics, which will accelerate discoveries in two dimensional quantum materials."

Zhang's research team will next focus on resolving how thermal vibrations are affected by defects and interfaces in quantum and electronic materials. Controlling the thermal vibration behavior of these materials could enable the design of novel devices with tailored thermal, electronic, and optical properties -- paving the way for advances in quantum computing, energy-efficient electronics, and nanoscale sensors.
articles.reasoning: The article describes a significant scientific breakthrough in imaging atomic thermal vibrations, confirming long-theorized phenomena and opening new possibilities for advanced technologies like quantum computing and ultra-efficient electronics. This kind of discovery is uplifting and hopeful as it advances human knowledge and technological progress.
articles.personality_title: Scientists capture never-before-seen atomic motion, opening new tech possibilities
articles.personality_presentation:
**Context**
Scientists have long believed that atoms inside materials are always moving in tiny, thermal vibrations. These movements influence how materials conduct heat and electricity. Until now, no one had been able to actually see these subtle atomic motions.

**What happened**
A team at the University of Maryland used a special electron microscopy method called electron ptychography to capture the very first images of atomic thermal vibrations. This technique shines electrons through materials and collects detailed patterns to create high-resolution pictures. They discovered “moiré phasons,” a special kind of atomic motion that was predicted but never directly observed.

**Impact**
This breakthrough confirms decades-old theories about atomic behavior and reveals hidden motions that affect how materials work. Understanding these movements can help scientists design better quantum computers, more efficient electronics, and advanced nanosensors, pushing technology to new heights.

**What's next step**
Researchers plan to use this imaging method to study a wider range of materials and their atomic motions. This could lead to the discovery of other hidden effects and help engineers build devices with improved performance and new capabilities.

**One-sentence takeaway**
A groundbreaking imaging technique has finally revealed hidden atomic vibrations, unlocking new directions for future cutting-edge technology.
articles.personality_title_fr: Des scientifiques capturent un mouvement atomique jamais vu, ouvrant de nouvelles possibilités technologiques
articles.personality_presentation_fr:
**Contexte**
Les scientifiques savent depuis longtemps que les atomes à l’intérieur des matériaux vibrent en permanence à cause de la chaleur. Ces vibrations influencent la conductivité thermique et électrique des matériaux. Mais jusqu’ici, personne n’avait pu les voir directement.

**Ce qui s’est passé**
Une équipe de l’Université du Maryland a utilisé une méthode spéciale de microscopie électronique appelée ptychographie électronique pour capturer les toutes premières images des vibrations thermiques atomiques. Cette technique envoie des électrons à travers les matériaux et collecte des motifs détaillés pour créer des images haute résolution. Ils ont découvert les « phasons moiré », un type de mouvement atomique prédit mais jamais observé directement.

**Impact**
Cette avancée confirme des théories vieilles de plusieurs décennies sur le comportement atomique et révèle des mouvements cachés qui influencent les propriétés des matériaux. Mieux comprendre ces vibrations aidera à concevoir de meilleurs ordinateurs quantiques, des électroniques ultra-efficaces et des nanosenseurs avancés.

**Prochaine étape**
Les chercheurs veulent utiliser cette méthode d’imagerie pour étudier un plus grand nombre de matériaux et leurs mouvements atomiques. Cela pourrait révéler d’autres phénomènes cachés et aider à créer des appareils avec de meilleures performances et de nouvelles fonctions.

**Message clé en une phrase**
Une technique d’imagerie révolutionnaire dévoile enfin les vibrations atomiques cachées, ouvrant la voie à des technologies de pointe.
articles.personality_title_es: Científicos capturan un movimiento atómico nunca visto, abriendo nuevas posibilidades tecnológicas
articles.personality_presentation_es:
**Contexto**
Los científicos saben desde hace mucho que los átomos dentro de los materiales vibran constantemente por el calor. Estos movimientos afectan cómo los materiales conducen el calor y la electricidad. Pero nadie había podido ver estas vibraciones directamente.

**Qué pasó**
Un equipo de la Universidad de Maryland usó una técnica especial de microscopía electrónica llamada ptychography electrónica para capturar las primeras imágenes de las vibraciones térmicas atómicas. Esta técnica envía electrones a través de los materiales y recoge patrones detallados para crear imágenes de alta resolución. Descubrieron los “fasones moiré”, un tipo de movimiento atómico predicho pero nunca antes observado.

**Impacto**
Este avance confirma teorías antiguas sobre el comportamiento atómico y revela movimientos ocultos que afectan las propiedades de los materiales. Entender estas vibraciones ayudará a diseñar mejores computadoras cuánticas, electrónicos ultraeficientes y nanosensores avanzados.

**Próximo paso**
Los investigadores planean usar esta técnica para estudiar más materiales y sus movimientos atómicos. Esto podría descubrir otros efectos ocultos y ayudar a crear dispositivos con mejor rendimiento y nuevas capacidades.

**Conclusión en una frase**
Una técnica innovadora de imagen ha revelado finalmente las vibraciones atómicas ocultas, abriendo nuevas direcciones para tecnologías futuras de vanguardia.
articles.image_prompt: A warm, detailed painting of an abstract, gently glowing lattice of interconnected hexagons symbolizing two-dimensional materials, with delicate, wave-like ripples flowing through the lattice to represent atomic thermal vibrations and moiré phasons, all rendered in soft natural hues of blues, greens, and warm golds against a dark, calming background.

articles.title: DeepMind and OpenAI models solve maths problems at level of top students
articles.summary: Nature, Published online: 24 July 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-02343-xFor the first time, large language models performed on a par with gold medallists in the International Mathematical Olympiad.
articles.content:
Models from OpenAI and DeepMind achieved gold medal scores in the International Mathematical Olympiad.Credit: MoiraM/Alamy

Google DeepMind announced on 21 July that its software had cracked a set of maths problems at the level of the world’s top high-school students, achieving a gold-medal score on questions from the International Mathematical Olympiad. At first sight, this marked only a marginal improvement over the prevous year’s performance. The company’s system had performed in the upper range of silver medal standard at the 2024 Olympiad, while this year it was evaluated in the lower range for a human gold medallist.

DeepMind AI crushes tough maths problems on par with top human solvers

But the grades this year hide a “big paradigm shift,” says Thang Luong, a computer scientist at DeepMind in Mountain View, California. The company achieved its previous feats using two artificial intelligence (AI) tools specifically designed to carry out rigorous logical steps in mathematical proofs, called AlphaGeometry and AlphaProof. The process required human experts to first translate the problems’ statements into something similar to a programming language, and then to translate the AI’s solutions back into English.

“This year, everything is natural language, end to end,” says Luong. The team employed a large language model (LLM) called Deep Think, which is based on its Gemini system but with some additional developments that made it better and faster at producing mathematical arguments, such as handling multiple chains of thought in parallel. “For a long time, I didn’t think we could go that far with LLMs,” Luong adds.

Deep Think scored 35 out of 42 points on the 6 problems that had been given to participants in this year’s Olympiad. Under an agreement with the organizers, the computer’s solutions were marked by the same judges who evaluated the human participants.

Separately, ChatGPT creator OpenAI, based in San Francisco, California, had its own LLM solve the same Mathematical Olympiad problems at gold medal level, but had its solutions evaluated independently.

Impressive performance

For years, many AI researchers have fallen in one of two camps. Until 2012, the leading approach for was to code the rules of logical thinking into the machine by hand. Since then, neural networks — which train automatically by learning from vast troves of data — have made a series of sensational breakthroughs, and tools such as OpenAI’s ChatGPT have now entered mainstream use.

DeepMind AI solves geometry problems at star-student level

Gary Marcus, a neuroscientist at New York University (NYU) in New York City, called the results by DeepMind and OpenAI “Awfully impressive.” Marcus is an advocate of the ‘coding logic by hand’ approach — also known as neurosymbolic AI — and a frequent critic of what he sees as hype surrounding LLMs. Still, writing on Substack with NYU computer scientist Ernest Davis, he commented that “to be able to solve math problems at the level of the top 67 high school students in the world is to have really good math problem solving chops”.

It remains to be seen whether LLM superiority on IMO problems is here to stay, or if neurosymbolic AI will claw its way back to the top. “At this point the two camps still keep developing,” says Luong, who works on both approaches. “They could converge together.”
articles.reasoning: The news highlights a significant scientific and technological breakthrough where AI models have achieved performance comparable to top human students in complex mathematics competitions. This represents progress in AI capabilities and educational tools, inspiring hope for future advancements in learning and problem-solving.
articles.personality_title: AI models match top students in tough math contest
articles.personality_presentation:
**Context**
For years, the International Mathematical Olympiad (IMO) has challenged the brightest high school students worldwide with tough math problems. These problems require deep thinking and creativity, making them a gold standard for math skills.

**What happened**
Recently, AI models from DeepMind and OpenAI solved IMO-level math problems and scored as well as gold medal winners. This means these AI systems can now tackle some of the most difficult math questions meant for top students.

**Impact**
This breakthrough shows AI is catching up to human experts in complex problem-solving. It opens doors for smarter educational tools that can help students learn and practice challenging math. It also hints at future AI that can support research and innovation by handling tricky math tasks.

**What's next step**
Researchers plan to improve these AI models even more, aiming to understand and solve a wider range of problems. They also want to make this technology available to teachers and learners, helping to boost math education everywhere.

**One-sentence takeaway**
AI is now solving the toughest high school math problems, matching the skills of the world’s best students and promising smarter learning tools ahead.
articles.personality_title_fr: Les modèles d’IA égalent les meilleurs élèves en mathématiques difficiles
articles.personality_presentation_fr:
**Contexte**
Depuis des années, l’Olympiade Internationale de Mathématiques (OIM) met au défi les meilleurs lycéens du monde avec des problèmes de mathématiques complexes. Ces questions demandent une réflexion profonde et de la créativité, ce qui en fait une référence en compétences mathématiques.

**Ce qui s’est passé**
Récemment, les modèles d’IA de DeepMind et OpenAI ont résolu des problèmes au niveau de l’OIM et obtenu un score équivalent à celui des médaillés d’or. Cela signifie que ces systèmes d’IA peuvent maintenant répondre à certaines des questions mathématiques les plus difficiles destinées aux meilleurs élèves.

**Impact**
Cette avancée montre que l’IA rattrape les experts humains en résolution de problèmes complexes. Elle ouvre la voie à des outils éducatifs plus intelligents pour aider les élèves à apprendre et pratiquer les mathématiques difficiles. Elle laisse aussi entrevoir des IA futures capables de soutenir la recherche en mathématiques.

**Prochaine étape**
Les chercheurs souhaitent encore améliorer ces modèles pour qu’ils comprennent et résolvent une plus grande variété de problèmes. Ils veulent aussi rendre cette technologie accessible aux enseignants et aux étudiants pour renforcer l’éducation en mathématiques partout.

**En une phrase**
L’IA résout désormais les problèmes mathématiques les plus complexes des lycéens, égalant les meilleurs élèves au monde et promettant des outils d’apprentissage plus efficaces.
articles.personality_title_es: Los modelos de IA igualan a los mejores estudiantes en matemáticas difíciles
articles.personality_presentation_es:
**Contexto**
Durante años, la Olimpiada Internacional de Matemáticas (OIM) ha desafiado a los estudiantes de secundaria más brillantes con problemas matemáticos complejos. Estas preguntas requieren pensamiento profundo y creatividad, siendo un estándar de oro en habilidades matemáticas.

**Qué pasó**
Recientemente, los modelos de IA de DeepMind y OpenAI resolvieron problemas al nivel de la OIM y obtuvieron puntuaciones similares a las de los ganadores de medallas de oro. Esto significa que estos sistemas de IA ahora pueden abordar algunas de las preguntas matemáticas más difíciles destinadas a los mejores estudiantes.

**Impacto**
Este avance muestra que la IA está alcanzando a los expertos humanos en resolución de problemas complejos. Abre la puerta a herramientas educativas más inteligentes que pueden ayudar a los estudiantes a aprender y practicar matemáticas difíciles. También sugiere que futuras IA podrán apoyar la investigación y la innovación manejando tareas matemáticas complejas.

**Próximo paso**
Los investigadores planean mejorar aún más estos modelos para comprender y resolver una gama más amplia de problemas. También quieren hacer esta tecnología accesible a profesores y estudiantes para fortalecer la educación matemática en todas partes.

**Una frase clave**
La IA ahora resuelve los problemas matemáticos más difíciles de secundaria, igualando las habilidades de los mejores estudiantes del mundo y prometiendo herramientas de aprendizaje más inteligentes.
articles.image_prompt: A detailed, warm painting of two glowing, intertwined neural networks shaped like elegant, abstract geometric figures solving complex math puzzles represented by floating, luminous Olympiad-style problem sheets, set against a soft, natural color palette of gentle blues, greens, and warm golds, evoking harmony between advanced AI reasoning and human-level mathematical achievement.

articles.title: EE says latest outage fixed after 'technical fault'
articles.summary: The mobile phone service provider says it carried out work overnight after customers reported problems.
articles.content:
EE says latest outage fixed after 'technical fault'

EE says it carried out further work overnight to fix a technical problem which left some customers unable to make or receive calls.

In the last 24 hours, hundreds of people who use the mobile provider have told the BBC they have experienced service issues.

It comes after thousands were left unable to make or receive calls earlier this week due to a technical issue which impacted both mobile and landline phones.

On Saturday, a spokesperson for BT - which owns EE - said the network was "running as normal" after maintenance was carried out last night, but that it was "monitoring" the situation.
articles.reasoning: The article reports that a technical fault causing an outage has been fixed, restoring mobile phone service. This resolution of a problem that affected many users is a positive development, reflecting effective problem-solving and service recovery.
articles.personality_title: Ee fixes mobile outage quickly after technical fault
articles.personality_presentation:
**Context**
Many EE customers faced trouble making or receiving calls recently, with issues affecting both mobile and landline phones. This caused frustration as communication is essential for daily life.

**What happened**
EE identified a technical fault causing the outage and worked overnight to resolve it. The company carried out special maintenance and fixes on their network systems to restore full service.

**Impact**
The repair successfully brought phone services back to normal for hundreds of users who had been affected. This quick action helped people reconnect with family, work, and emergency contacts without long delays.

**What's next step**
EE plans to keep monitoring their network closely to prevent similar issues in the future. By improving their technical checks and maintenance routines, they aim to provide more reliable service.

**One-sentence takeaway**
Thanks to fast problem-solving, EE quickly fixed the phone outage and got customers back online smoothly.
articles.personality_title_fr: Ee répare rapidement la panne mobile après un défaut technique
articles.personality_presentation_fr:
**Contexte**
De nombreux clients d'EE ont rencontré des difficultés à passer ou recevoir des appels récemment, avec des problèmes touchant à la fois les mobiles et les lignes fixes. Cela a causé de la frustration car la communication est essentielle au quotidien.

**Ce qui s'est passé**
EE a identifié un défaut technique à l'origine de la panne et a travaillé toute la nuit pour le résoudre. L'entreprise a effectué une maintenance spéciale et des réparations sur ses systèmes réseau pour rétablir le service complet.

**Impact**
La réparation a permis de rétablir avec succès les services téléphoniques pour des centaines d'utilisateurs affectés. Cette action rapide a aidé les gens à reprendre contact avec leur famille, leur travail et les contacts d'urgence sans longs délais.

**Prochaine étape**
EE prévoit de continuer à surveiller étroitement son réseau pour éviter des problèmes similaires à l'avenir. En améliorant leurs contrôles techniques et leurs routines de maintenance, ils visent à offrir un service plus fiable.

**Leçon en une phrase**
Grâce à une résolution rapide, EE a rapidement corrigé la panne téléphonique et a remis ses clients en ligne sans encombre.
articles.personality_title_es: Ee soluciona rápidamente la caída del móvil tras fallo técnico
articles.personality_presentation_es:
**Contexto**
Muchos clientes de EE tuvieron problemas para hacer o recibir llamadas recientemente, afectando tanto móviles como teléfonos fijos. Esto causó frustración porque la comunicación es vital en el día a día.

**Qué pasó**
EE identificó un fallo técnico que causó la caída y trabajó durante la noche para solucionarlo. La compañía realizó mantenimiento especial y reparaciones en sus sistemas de red para restablecer el servicio completo.

**Impacto**
La reparación devolvió con éxito el servicio telefónico a cientos de usuarios afectados. Esta acción rápida ayudó a las personas a reconectarse con familiares, trabajo y contactos de emergencia sin largas esperas.

**Próximo paso**
EE planea seguir monitoreando su red cuidadosamente para evitar problemas similares en el futuro. Mejorando sus controles técnicos y rutinas de mantenimiento, buscan ofrecer un servicio más confiable.

**Conclusión en una frase**
Gracias a una rápida solución, EE arregló la caída telefónica y volvió a conectar a sus clientes sin problemas.
articles.image_prompt: A detailed, warmly colored painting of a glowing, interconnected network of vintage telephone handsets and mobile phones gently linked by soft, flowing golden wires, set against a calm evening sky with subtle hints of stars, symbolizing restored communication and seamless connection after a technical disruption.
